title: Sunak told Home Office to halve migrant hotel closures
description: PM’s lack of faith in Rwanda policy blamed for planned being scaled down as empty beds cost taxpayer £1.5m a day

title: Conservative rebellion avoided as North Sea oil and gas vote rescheduled
description: An expected Conservative rebellion over Rishi Sunak’s controversial plans to expand oil and gas drilling was postponed on Thursday after a vote on flagship legislation was rescheduled at the last minute.

title: Starmer slams Sunak's slow response to UK flooding as thousands of homes devastated
description: Touring flooded homes in Loughborough afflicted by Storm Henk Labour leader Keir Starmer slammed the Government's response to the disaster which he says wasn't fast enough

title: Plan to fast-track postmaster exonerations to be set out shortly, minister says
description: Post Office minister Kevin Hollinrake told MPs that the plans aimed to resolve outstanding criminal convictions 'with much more pace'

title: Boost for BAE as Germans finally give the green light to £5bn Saudi Typhoon jet deal
description: The defence giant signed a memorandum of understanding to sell the kingdom 48 of the aircraft (pictured) back in 2018 for a reported £5bn.

title: Ministers seeking to speed up Post Office appeals
description: Campaigners called for the Post Office to be prevented from taking part in appeals against the convictions of former sub-postmasters. The government also announced retired judge Sir Gary Hickinbottom would chair an independent panel overseeing compensation payments to those whose convictions have been overturned.

title: Rishi Sunak scores an own goal at Accrington Stanley
description: I say this only to point out that, when he’s turning in little circles around a tiny coffee table inside a very small room at Accrington Stanley Football Club, doing something that used to be called a speech but which he has decided to call a “PM Connect event” instead,

title: Exclusive: Rishi Sunak Accused Of 'Stuffing' Public Meeting With Tory Members
description: An anti-Trump PAC gave a dire warning to 2024 voters with an ad campaign Monday, saying the former president is likely to encourage a second Jan. 6-like riot. title: Post Office scandal: Former minister calls for mass appeal against convictions
description: The situation is different in Scotland and in Northern Ireland. Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has said the government is reviewing options, including stripping the Post Office of its role in the appeal process, and is also looking at how to speed up the ...

title: Rishi Sunak's Treasury accused of holding up proper compensation for Post Office victims

description: Former Post Office boss Paula Vennells was coming under greater pressure over her CBE after Rishi Sunak signalled he would support a committee looking into the honour. The Prime Minister’s official spokesman said he would “strongly support” the ...

title: Rishi Sunak Has Claimed He Is Making 'Progress' On His 5 Pledges To Voters And People Aren't Convinced
description: Rishi Sunak has been criticised after he claimed he had “made progress’ on “all five” of his pledges to voters. He promised a year ago that he would halve inflation, grow the economy, reduce debt, cut NHS waiting lists and “stop the boats”.

title: Rishi Sunak Would 'Strongly Support' Moves To Strip Former Post Office Boss Of CBE
description: Downing Street said the prime minister “shares the public’s feeling of outrage” over the Horizon scandal. More than a million people have now signed a petition demanding that Paula Vennells lose her gong. Hundreds of sub-postmasters were wrongly ...

title: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s two-day visit to the High Peak
description: Rishi Sunak made a special two-day visit to the High Peak to hold a farmers policy discussion – and present a local pub with a special award.

title: Post Office scandal: PM “strongly supports” withdrawing CBE from ex-Post Office boss
description: “We are on it” Rishi Sunak declared today as he sought to reassure sub-postmasters who were wrongly convicted of defrauding the Post Office in the Horizon scandal that he would speed up the process of quashing their convictions and making sure they get full compensation.

title: Fujitsu could pay compensation for Post Office scandal, minister suggests
description: Ministers are considering chasing Fujitsu for millions of pounds in compensation for the victims of the Post Office Horizon scandal. Around £138 million has already been paid to victims and hundreds of others are still waiting, with the bill covered by the taxpayer.

title: Justice for Horizon scandal victims 'is my highest priority', Post Office minister vows
description: Former High Court judge Sir Gary Hickinbottom will chair an independent panel assessing the financial losses of postmasters with overturned convictions, it was announced.

title: Scots won’t get income tax cuts even if there is a pre-election giveaway in rest of UK, warns Yousaf
description: Cross-border tax gap likely to widen if Jeremy Hunt announces changes to the levy as SNP leader rules out revising budget plans

title: Rishi Sunak Warms Of 'Square One' With Keir Starmer – And That Doesn't Sound So Bad To Many
description: Tory leader changes election strategy, billing himself as a continuity candidate after saying "change" 30 times in his October conference speech.

title: Pain for Rishi Sunak as by-election confirmed and Reform rises in poll
description: Rishi Sunak is facing more electoral pain after it was confirmed there is to be a by-election in a Labour target seat and an opinion poll showed

title: Ministers scramble to clear names of victims of Post Office Horizon scandal
description: Government draws up plans to speed up process of justice for those who were wrongfully convicted as public pressure grows

description: Prime minister speaks in Lancashire as MP says Tories have to accept ‘we have left the country sadder and less united’

title: Rishi Sunak Keeps Getting Community Noted On X For Posting Misleading Claims
description: Rishi Sunak has been repeatedly rapped for posting misleading claims on X, the social media platform formerly known as Twitter. Since New Year’s Eve, the prime minister has been “community noted” on numerous occasions following a series of posts boasting about the government’s performance.

title: Rishi Sunak Alters UK Conservative Election Strategy to Continuity from Change
description: Rishi Sunak raised eyebrows in October when he pitched himself to Conservative activists at his party’s annual conference as the “change” candidate despite the Tories ruling for the past 13 years. That no longer appears to be the plan.

title: PM vows to ‘confront difficult challenges’ as he heads to Lancashire
description: Ahead of Parliament’s return on Monday, Mr Sunak is expected to visit businesses and speak with voters in Lancashire as part of his so-called PM Connect series. The Commons will later debate the Offshore Petroleum Licensing Bill, which has already led to the resignation of one senior Tory.

title: More snow flurries expected across England, amid warning for ice
description: The wintry weather comes after Prime Minister Rishi Sunak visited flood-hit residents in Oxford, and as Environment Agency workers are still trying to mop up from the heavy rainfall and high winds during Storm Henk last week. The Environment Agency said ...

title: Rishi Sunak loves being PM – that’s why there won’t be an election until Autumn
